do nasus players know how to dance

ive never seen nasus's dance

or his taunts
Nasus players don't have time to dance or taunt. We are too busy stacking. Unless you're trick2g you will be dancing/taunting all game :)
I wonder what is his default build.

Gaunlet > Rot > Swift Boots > Deadmans plate > Steraks > Thornmail or BV
I rush a negatron cloak if I'm up against an AP top

Sirhcez as a Nasus main myself {{champion:75}}  (only other one is Masters with you aside from when I tilt outa it , and #1 Nasus in NA according to [LoLSkill](http://www.lolskill.net/top/highest-lolskillscore?filterChampion=75&filterRealm=NA) :P I only have Nasus played in ranked). [Op.gg](http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=angormus) I have to say, I don't like your runes and the 30% scaling cooldown reduction thing you have going on.

Can you explain? I usually go Armor Quints or Magic Resist Quints depending on the matchup to actually help me survive early laning phase and then you can buy IBG + Spirit Visage anyways since it's amazing with your passive life steal. Why would I want to go 30% scaling cooldown reduction over more defensive runes?

Also why do you never build Sterak's gage? I find it to be  very nice for a defensive item as a 3rd/4th item depending since it gives you a huge shield that's really nice for countering burst and I see you never build it.

What do you think of what I usually build?

Vs Ad I usually do: Glacial -> Kindlegem -> Sheen -> Tabi -> IBG -> Spirit Visage -> Steraks Gage -> Zz'rot
Vs Ap I usually do: Spectre's Cowl -> Kindlegem -> Glacial -> Sheen -> Mercury Treads -> Spirit Visage -> IBG -> Steraks Gage -> Zz'rot
rip no reply. I'd like to see what he says.

I watch a lot of sirchez and trick2g and iirc the 30% he got from trick. I think the reason they run that page is because it allows them to cap out their cdr with just sheen, and then they can rush {{item:3512}}  and {{item:3742}}  without having to get more cdr. Also the reason he doesn't get steraks is because he almost never teamfights. Getting early {{item:3512}} and {{item:3742}} and {{item:3009}} just means that he can push a tower down and have the ms to run away when people come to chase him.
SirchEz is the chilliest dude love watching his stream. stays calm in a stressful competitive game and never rages. I strive to be like him.

What do you think about AP Nasus?
Have you tried it before?

AP Nasus is very strong. You don't get too much stacks as AP nasus because you max E first and it usually clears the minion wave.

I only go AP if I get mid lane
My AP build: Morello > Sorc Boots > Zhonyas or Abyssal (depending if ur up against ap or ad) > Lich Bane > Liandrys

How do you manage mana early? Before my first back, I usually run out of mana very quickly even when restricting myself from E'ing very much. 

Also what is a typical build path? 

Is ice born a good first item? 

Do you reccomend stacking CD-R components early for maximum stack age? For instance, I usually start with kindle gem then get glacial shroud, followed by sheen. After this then I start finishing items. Do you recommend this?

Thanks for doing this!

Early laneing phase you should only use your Q (20 mana) to last hit minions and get those stacks. I only use my W if the enemy starts engaging on me to run away and you shouldn't be using ur E at all to harass unless its to last hit minions. If you follow those steps, you shouldn't be running out of mana. The only time you should use ur W and E is if the jungler is ganking ur lane.

build path: Gaunlet > Rot > Swift boots > deadmans plate > Steraks > Thornmail or BV
Rush early MR if ur up against an AP top

Yes that build order looks good! always try to cap ur CDR ASAP
^^ I don't even take E. Spirit Fire is useless, I take it at level 13.
I find the armor shred to be insanely strong even just at rank 1

Chris! Enjoy the stream! How do you most often utilize teleport on Nasus? Is it to clean up a fight to go to the bottom lane early or to get back into lane? I queue with others that want me to TP bottom more often, but then my stacks are low. If the game is even what do you do?

I'm pretty selfish with my Teleport. I usually just tp back in lane to get stacks or tp to open the GATES(take towers/inhibs)! Very rarely do I actually teleport to help my team

Always rememeber.. Stacks > Team :)
i've heard that if you're q stacking and the iceborn gauntlet kills the minion it doesn't give you the stacks, is this true?
Yes that is true.
Do you take {{summoner:4}} ? or do you prefer {{summoner:6}} and {{summoner:12}} ?

Flash is good if they have an aggressive early game jungler (Lee, Vi, etc.) Ghost is better for late game as it allows you to push objectives and have a prolonged escape instead of 1 simple dash. Also good for taking objectives.
I watch Chris all the time, he runs flash.
Iceborn Gauntlet or Triforce + Frozen Heart?
This season I believe Gaunlet is better than triforce. Its cheaper to build and you can rush zZ rot right away to breach gates
WHO LET THE DOGS OUT!?{{champion:75}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:75}}
CDR or MR blues? Also, do you go Iceborn or Triforce for the sheen item?

I prefer CDR. I want to cap my CDR ASAP so I can get those early stacks. I use to build triforce all the time, but with the new season and the fast paced games, I have started to like Iceborn more. You get early tank stats and its a lot cheaper to build

What are some really good counters against Nasus? Who counters him when in lane and what is a good team comp against him? Most of my games I play against Nasus, everyone lets him free farm top lane or the top laner on my team feeds him and he begins to one hit. My friends and I believe he isn't balanced, so what is your advice to keep the enemy Nasus from snowballing?

Really good counters are Quinn, Vayne, Darius, Olaf, Teemo, Pantheon. Pretty much lane bullies. You want to be really aggressive and try to deny nasus as much stacks as possible. Take advantage of his weak laning phase. Good comps against nasus are champs with a lot of stuns/slows, but most nasus mains dont really team fight. They like to split push and put a lot of pressure. So you need take advantage of that and goon squad him.

Another good way to shut down nasus is to camp him and make him useless all game. Nasus is really easy to kill early game
How do you main Nasus??? Isnt he just about stacking Q, not much to learn tbh.
Thats the difference between a good players mentality and a mediocre player. :)
What do you think the best keystone mastery for nasus is right now?
Surge and Grasp are probably the best Keystones right now
Do you think the new reworked keystone mastery, warlord's bloodlust is any good on him?
If you are actually getting low enough to make use of Warlords, you are probably playing Nasus wrong.

Nasus is a sort of go to pick for me when I'm top so I like to think I know a fair bit of how to play him, when playing against champions like olaf or fiora though I'm completely lost, any tips on how to deal with those specific champions in the laning phase?

Yah those 2 champs are pretty tough. I consider them counter picks. Usually I wait for the minion wave to push to my tower and farm cs/stacks under turret. Play really passive and just farm for the late game. Its probably best not to fight olaf or fiora 1 v 1 cause they probably will win. If they end up freezing the lane, ask the jungler to help shove the lane so they cant freeze

I actually have a question myself. What's better, Stormraider's or Grasp of the Undying? And also Flash or Ghost?

I've used both Stormraider's and Grasp together both. While Grasp is meant more for the early stages than later on, I've found Stormraider's to be REALLY useful to negate his inability to stick to some targets that can't be slow by him (Riven, LeBlanc, etc.). 

As for flash and ghost, I've had trouble with both of them and I don't know what feels better or works better, any thoughts? I can see Ghost for also sticking to targets by then I have Stormraider's for that.

Thanks Mr. SirhcEz! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Both surge and grasp are great keystones for Nasus. Surge is great against enemy team comps with slows and grasp for any other situation. Like you mentioned, Surge is good for sticking on to the enemy champions to kill them or even for escaping.

I prefer flash over ghost because people dont expect the flash + Q and instantly killing them. The enemy has more time to react if you tried to ghost and kill them with ur Q.
